author: Mark Anderson
title: 17 locals will compete for arena public-art commissions
text:
Courtesy of city of Sacramento A colorful piece from the "Coloring Book" series by renowned sculptor Jeff Koons will beâ€¦ more The colorful and celebrated $8 million sculpture by Jeff Koons is only one of many artworks planned for Golden 1 Center. On Monday, the Sacramento Metropolitan Arts Commission is expected to choose 17 artists who will compete to win additional commissions for the arena project. The Koons sculpture, which has already been approved , will be the high-profile centerpiece. Four other commissions, worth a total of $1.3 million, are reserved for Northern California artists. A panel chose the 17 recommended finalists from 135 applications. They come from Alameda, Butte, Placer, Sacramento, San Francisco and Yolo counties. Once formally selected as finalists on Monday, artists chosen will tour the arena site. They will then submit proposals for their public art this fall. The arena is to open in the fall of 2016. One piece of art, a commission worth $50,000, will be programmed into LED screens at the entrance to the Golden 1 Center. The other three commissions will range between $250,000 and $400,000. One will be at the new plaza entrance to the arena at J street. Another is for an installation on L Street. A third commission will be for art for three escalator wells. The local artist finalists are Bryan Valenzuela , Estaban Villa , Suzanne Adan , Anthony Padilla , Gale Hart and Jiayi Young all of Sacramento; Michael Bishop and Jess Riegel of Placer County; and Nelson Loskamp of Yolo County. The commission meeting is at 2 p.m. on Monday at 1030 15th St.
